text:
All, I am using streaming API, i was able to get match odds and traded volume data, now i want to get additional "OVER_UNDER_25" Back/Lay price and traded volume.
I used below filter to set market_types to "OVER_UNDER_25", but no "OVER_UNDER_25" data return, Any suggestions?

market_filter = streaming_market_filter(
    event_type_ids=["1"], market_types=["MATCH_ODDS", "OVER_UNDER_25"], market_ids=["1.172086373"]
)

elements.text:

text: You have a hardcoded market_id in there, remove that and you should be good

text: Unless that market ID is an over under market then your comment was correct

elements.text: Unless that market ID is an over under market then your comment was correct

text: Event types (1) have events (29958270) which have markets (Match Odds - 1.172086373) which have runners (58805), you had filtered on 2 market types + a marketId (Match Odds) thus restricting it to just the Match Odds market. You need to go up a level and filter on the eventId to get the other markets in the event <https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Navigation+Data+For+Applications>

elements.text: Event types (1) have events (29958270) which have markets (Match Odds - 1.172086373) which have runners (58805), you had filtered on 2 market types + a marketId (Match Odds) thus restricting it to just the Match Odds market. You need to go up a level and filter on the eventId to get the other markets in the event

text: <@U4H19D1D2> whats the difference between `place_reset_seconds` and `reset_seconds`?

Tried to explain it <https://liampauling.github.io/flumine/trades/#parameters|here>, `place_reset_seconds` is seconds since the last order was reset i.e. complete where as `reset_seconds` is just seconds since the last place on that runner

elements.text: is seconds since the last order was reset i.e. complete where as
is just seconds since the last place on that runner

text: so `place_reset_seconds` would be place every x seconds regardless of the result and `reset_seconds` would be place every x seconds after the previous trade is in `COMPLETE` state. is that right?

elements.text: would be place every x seconds regardless of the result and
would be place every x seconds after the previous trade is in

text: other way around
welcome a name change on the vars if its clearer
